message.content:
Sure, you can use LibreOffice Calc's built-in functions `SUBSTITUTE` and `INDIRECT` for this purpose. Here is a simple example of how it could be done:

```plaintext
=SUBSTITUTE(INDIRECT("A1"), "'", "")
```
In the above expression, we are first using the `INDIRECT` function to get the value from cell A1 and then replacing all single quotes in that string with nothing (i.e., removing them) by using the `SUBSTITUTE` function. 

Please replace "A1" with your actual source cell reference, if it's different. Also note that this will only remove single quotes from the text - any other special characters or formatting in the original cell won't be affected.
